page.title: 17BOTLEY FLOUR MILLS
page.content: Botley Flour Mills were mentioned in the first Domesday Book:"2 mills worth 20 shillings".Amongst the owners have been the Earl of Southampton and the Duke of Portland. In 1921 the Botley Flour Milling Co. was formed and came under the control of the Appleby family who still own it today.The policy of the mill is to keep up to date with milling techniques and they have just opened a new animal feed mill with micro_processor controls.Only one person is needed to operate the whole mill.Water power can still be used to make Stoneground Wholemeal flour but most work is done by electricity.Many specialised grades of flour are produced to suit customers' individual needs.
